titlestmt.titleproper: Smith-Houston-Ogden family papers. Joseph Wood papers (series 82) 1824-1926
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Smith-Houston-Ogden family papers. Joseph Wood papers (series 82)

bioghist.p: The Wood family is allied to the Smith family through the marriage of Rebecca Levis Wood and Abraham Lewis Smith. John Wood married Sarah Tipping. Their son, Joseph, married Margaret Garrett Levis. Joseph and Margaret Wood were the parents of Rebecca Levis Wood (1837-1925). Rebecca Levis Wood married Abraham Lewis Smith; their son, Lewis Lawrence Smith, was the father of Lawrence M.C. Smith.

scopecontent.p: Materials in this collection include: business and family correspondence of Joseph and Margaret Levis Wood; bank books and letterbook of Joseph Wood; bills and receipts; photographs of John and Sarah Wood; commonplace book and autograph album; mementos, including locks of hair belonging to various Wood family members; and genealogical research on John Wood and other Woods and Tippings conducted by a hired researcher.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
